TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> So people can't post nasty stuff and then try to hide it.
> 

How about post editions?

My terrible grammars mistakes are eternized in diff entries on the forum database for the Moderation amusement for eternity?
We can see all the versions of a post which were submitted.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> We can see all the versions of a post which were submitted.
> 

Nothing gets by these guys. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

Literally nothing. They don’t actually delete anything, offending posts are moved, not ***re***moved, and compiled in an archive under electronic lock and key. 

So, in effect the mods have their own Forbidden Library. ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif ":sealed:")

This amuses me to no end. 

Whether it involves arcane chanting and rattling chains, they remain irkingly tight lipped. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

> 
>

> 
> 
> My terrible grammars mistakes are eternized in diff entries on the forum database for the Moderation amusement for eternity?
>

I've been getting this "The search index is currently processing. Activity stream results may not be complete." message on my activity stream for around 8 hours today. What is it about? Also a bunch of my notifications have been marked unread and they don't become read (you know, a bit greyed out) even if I revisit them.

I am thinking of making a "magazine" thread where i report of new inventions, players opinions on changes and features, along with results of various competitions. would this be allowed under forum rules?  Would creating a thread where I ask the forums  opinions on subjects relating to ksp and it's expansions be allowed?

**Edited <time datetime="2019-06-13T15:26:17Z" title="06/13/2019 03:26  PM" data-short="5 yr">June 13, 2019</time> by lapis**

Before this week's IPS update (at least I hope you guys updated because the mobile forum now has a bunch of new features), forum notifications would stay "bolded" or shown as unread when first expanding the notifications pane. This no longer happens, and all notifications are automatically "unbold" or shown as read. 

Is this intentional? Or a bug? Or a new setting I'm missing?

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, lapis said:
> 
> 
> I am thinking of making a "magazine" thread where i report of new inventions, players opinions on changes and features, along with results of various competitions. would this be allowed under forum rules?
> 

Yes, this would be allowed. We'd probably put it into Kerbal Network, since it would be about the forum.

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, lapis said:
> 
> 
> Would creating a thread where I ask the forums  opinions on subjects relating to ksp and it's expansions be allowed?
> 

Yes, this would be allowed, but there's probably already a thread about some of the things you want to talk about. We might end up merging threads, depending on how things work out. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
